p: To further quantify the stability of the system across 1897 to 1991, we calculated both local and global Lyapunov exponents [ 3]. From the fitted model, we calculated the dominant Lyapunov exponent, and found no evidence of chaotic dynamics, despite multiple dynamical jumps between the attractors (LE = -0.04, range: -0.28–0.11, Fig 5). This is again in contrast with pre-vaccination US measles, where chaotic (LE > 0) dynamics dominated [ 5]. In terms of local dynamics, the LLEs point to stability around two biannual attractors (1920–1935 and 1950–1965, Fig 5). However, LLEs in this context may be more qualitative, as we are comparing mean birth rates in an era ( Fig 5A & 5C) against the time-varying, true birth rates ( Fig 5B & 5D).
